fields.headline: Populating space
fields.bodyText: Stephen Hawking (Report, 10 August) is wildly optimistic if he believes we could colonise space within the next two centuries. The perfect storm of expanding population, global warming, toxic oceans, water shortages, desertification etc will probably overwhelm us over the next few decades, with little hope of effective counter-measures. Anyway, regarding colonisation of space, Joel E Cohen's terse comment in 1995 says it all: "Let me dispense once and for all with extraterrestrial emigration. To achieve a reduction in the global population growth rate from, say, 1.6% to 1.5% would currently require the departure of 0.001 x 5.7 billion = 5.7 million astronauts in the first year and increasing numbers in each later year. To export this number of people would bankrupt the remaining Earthlings and would still leave a population that doubled every 46 years. Demographically speaking, space is not the place." Alec Ponton Newcastle upon Tyne
